## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron ore mining and smelting setup at (15.5, 70.5)
- Electric mining drill at (15.5, 70.5) facing DOWN (output at 15.5, 72.5)
- Small electric pole at (13.5, 69.5) powering the drill
- Stone furnace at (17.0, 73.0) (currently unpowered and without fuel)
- Wooden chest at (17.5, 73.5) (attempted placement)

### Power generation setup at (-9.5, -0.5)
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 0.5) connected via pipes to:
- Boiler at (-5.0, 3.5) (fueled with coal)
- Steam engine at (-0.5, 3.5) properly connected
- Pipe network connecting offshore pump to boiler (positions: (-8.5,-0.5), (-6.5,-0.5), (-7.5,-0.5), (-4.5,-0.5), (-5.5,-0.5), (-3.5,-0.5))
- Power pole at (3.5, 3.5) connecting the system

## ERROR TIPS

### Placement collision errors
- Verify target position is clear before placing entities (repeated 5 times with chests/inserters)
- Check for existing objects at target location before placement attempts
- For inserters, ensure proper spacing between furnace and output chest

### Entity attribute errors
- When calculating positions relative to entities, verify available attributes (WIDTH not available for boilers)

### Mining setup issues
- Ensure furnaces are placed in correct orientation to receive ore from drills
- Verify fuel is added to furnaces for smelting operations
- Check inserter placement positions relative to furnace input/output

### Fluid system warnings
- Monitor boiler water levels to prevent running dry
- Verify steam engine is receiving proper steam input

### Power connection verification
- Confirm power connections are properly established before assuming machines are powered
- Check energy levels of machines after connection attempts

### Placement sequence
- Plan complete mining/smelting setups before placement to avoid rework
- Ensure proper spacing between connected entities before placement
